file_content.text: Here.
No sign of pursuit. Watch my six while I cover the retreat.
This new emperor. You've met him?
I have.
What's your assessment?
He's overconfident, but almost as invincible as he believes he is.
Arcann is powerful.
Are the young not always so deluded? His grapple with mortality is yet to come.
His father twisted and used up entire worlds according to his whims. Imagine being a child in that shadow.
He's a victim too.
Mine was not the only shadow the boy stood in.
Valkorion believed he could start something new and different here, but in the end he only taught his heirs to be every bit the Sith he was.
Like father, like son.
Or perhaps it is merely the nature of a son to seek to surpass his father.
Nothing but despots left in this galaxy.
The Republic you fought for? It doesn't exist.
The Republic I signed up to protect doesn't exist anymore.
We gave the reins over to people who don't care how we win, just as long as we do.
Saresh is all but a dictator now.
Can't the Senate keep her in check?
There's no opposition?
They don't even weigh in on military matters anymore.
Don't you pride yourselves on keeping all the power out of the hands of one individual?
How did that happen?
I thought you had laws to prevent that sort of thing.
How is that possible?
Not enough politicians with the spine to stick to their principles when it really mattered.
Don't you think that's taking it to an extreme?
You must be exaggerating.
The Senate hasn't voted on a war issue in almost two years.
So, not everything has changed since I've been gone.
Sounds like her.
That's why you broke all your official ties and went rogue.
I understand why you're here.
And that was enough for you to walk away from everything you swore to protect?
So you deserted.
I'll fight for the Republic until the day I die. I won't fight for a political agenda.
Saresh and her puppet Chancellor have everyone convinced the state of emergency requires executive action. She and the top brass just push through whatever suits their interests.
Never thought I'd miss bureaucrats butting into military matters, but what we gained in efficiency we lost in soul.
This is a fight you can believe in, at least.
We'll make the difference here.
I'm holding you to that.
Once Arcann's out of the picture, we can get the Republic back on track.
The Republic can be saved.
Let's hope so.
Those are problems you can worry about after we've dealt with Arcann.
Focus on the task at hand.
True enough.
A war won't wait for you to tally votes, and it doesn't care if you can't reach a consensus.
Maybe Saresh is right.
Someone still has to answer for those decisions at the end of the day.
Hold on-- got something.
Civvies... and Skytroopers. They're in trouble.
Keep the pressure on those droids until I've engaged.
Cover me, Jorgan.
Affirmative.
What do you want to do?
Your call, Jorgan.
You have to ask?
They can keep the droids distracted while we withdraw.
Perfect time to escape.
Not happening.
They're our problem now.
Distract them while I close the gap.
Cover me, Jorgan.
Lay into them. I'm going in.
Cover me, Jorgan.
